images.copyright: The Hickman Bridge at Capitol Reef National Park, Utah (© Tim Fitzharris/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Take the trail more traveled by
images.caption: Happy birthday, Capitol Reef National Park
images.desc: You won't find a lot of solitude on the Hickman Bridge Trail, a 1.7-mile route in Capitol Reef National Park that leads to this magnificent natural arch. The trail is used by hikers, runners, and nature lovers drawn by incredible rock formations, gullies, and remnants from the ancient Fremont Culture civilization. Hickman Bridge itself is one of the best-known geologic features of the park.
images.bsTitle: Take the trail more traveled by
